example.para: Activates the gateway you previously deployed on your host.

code.title: To activate the gateway

example.para: The following example shows a request that activates a gateway-stored volume.

code.title: To add a cache

example.para: Adds one or more tags to the specified resource.

code.title: To add tags to resource

example.para: Configures one or more gateway local disks as upload buffer for a specified gateway.

code.title: To add upload buffer on local disk

example.para: Configures one or more gateway local disks as working storage for a gateway. (Working storage is also referred to as upload buffer.)

code.title: To add storage on local disk

example.para: Cancels archiving of a virtual tape to the virtual tape shelf (VTS) after the archiving process is initiated.

code.title: To cancel virtual tape archiving

example.para: Cancels retrieval of a virtual tape from the virtual tape shelf (VTS) to a gateway after the retrieval process is initiated.

code.title: To cancel virtual tape retrieval

example.para: Creates a cached volume on a specified cached gateway.

code.title: To create a cached iSCSI volume

example.para: Initiates an ad-hoc snapshot of a gateway volume.

code.title: To create a snapshot of a gateway volume

example.para: Initiates a snapshot of a gateway from a volume recovery point.

code.title: To create a snapshot of a gateway volume

example.para: Creates a stored volume on a specified stored gateway.

code.title: To create a stored iSCSI volume

example.para: Creates one or more virtual tapes.

code.title: To create a virtual tape

example.para: Creates a virtual tape by using your own barcode.

code.title: To create a virtual tape using a barcode

example.para: Deletes the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway; either the upload or download limit, or both.

code.title: To delete bandwidth rate limits of gateway

example.para: Deletes Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) credentials for a specified iSCSI target and initiator pair.

code.title: To delete CHAP credentials

example.para: This operation deletes the gateway, but not the gateway's VM from the host computer.

code.title: To delete a gatgeway

example.para: This action enables you to delete a snapshot schedule for a volume.

code.title: To delete a snapshot of a volume

example.para: This example deletes the specified virtual tape.

code.title: To delete a virtual tape

example.para: Deletes the specified virtual tape from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).

code.title: To delete a virtual tape from the shelf (VTS)

example.para: Deletes the specified gateway volume that you previously created using the CreateCachediSCSIVolume or CreateStorediSCSIVolume API.

code.title: To delete a gateway volume

example.para: Returns a value for a bandwidth rate limit if set. If not set, then only the gateway ARN is returned.

code.title: To describe the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway

example.para: Returns information about the cache of a gateway.

code.title: To describe cache information

example.para: Returns a description of the gateway cached iSCSI volumes specified in the request.

code.title: To describe gateway cached iSCSI volumes

example.para: Returns an array of Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) credentials information for a specified iSCSI target, one for each target-initiator pair.

code.title: To describe CHAP credetnitals for an iSCSI

example.para: Returns metadata about a gateway such as its name, network interfaces, configured time zone, and the state (whether the gateway is running or not).

code.title: To describe metadata about the gateway

example.para: Returns your gateway's weekly maintenance start time including the day and time of the week.

code.title: To describe gateway's maintenance start time

example.para: Describes the snapshot schedule for the specified gateway volume including intervals at which snapshots are automatically initiated.

code.title: To describe snapshot schedule for gateway volume

example.para: Returns the description of the gateway volumes specified in the request belonging to the same gateway.

code.title: To describe the volumes of a gateway

example.para: Returns a description of specified virtual tapes in the virtual tape shelf (VTS).

code.title: To describe virtual tapes in the VTS

example.para: Returns a list of virtual tape recovery points that are available for the specified gateway-VTL.

code.title: To describe virtual tape recovery points

example.para: Returns a description of the specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of virtual tapes. If a TapeARN is not specified, returns a description of all virtual tapes.

code.title: To describe virtual tape(s) associated with gateway

example.para: Returns information about the upload buffer of a gateway including disk IDs and the amount of upload buffer space allocated/used.

code.title: To describe upload buffer of gateway

example.para: Returns information about the upload buffer of a gateway including disk IDs and the amount of upload buffer space allocated and used.

code.title: To describe upload buffer of a gateway

example.para: Returns a description of virtual tape library (VTL) devices for the specified gateway.

code.title: To describe virtual tape library (VTL) devices of a single gateway

example.para: This operation is supported only for the gateway-stored volume architecture. This operation is deprecated in cached-volumes API version (20120630). Use DescribeUploadBuffer instead.

code.title: To describe the working storage of a gateway [Depreciated]

example.para: Disables a gateway when the gateway is no longer functioning. Use this operation for a gateway-VTL that is not reachable or not functioning.

code.title: To disable a gateway when it is no longer functioning

example.para: Lists gateways owned by an AWS account in a specified region as requested. Results are sorted by gateway ARN up to a maximum of 100 gateways.

code.title: To lists region specific gateways per AWS account

example.para: The request returns a list of all disks, specifying which are configured as working storage, cache storage, or stored volume or not configured at all.

code.title: To list the gateway's local disks

example.para: Lists the tags that have been added to the specified resource.

code.title: To list tags that have been added to a resource

example.para: Lists the recovery points for a specified gateway in which all data of the volume is consistent and can be used to create a snapshot.

code.title: To list recovery points for a gateway

example.para: Lists the iSCSI stored volumes of a gateway. Results are sorted by volume ARN up to a maximum of 100 volumes.

code.title: To list the iSCSI stored volumes of a gateway

example.para: Lists the iSCSI stored volumes of a gateway. Removes one or more tags from the specified resource.

code.title: To remove tags from a resource

example.para: Resets all cache disks that have encountered a error and makes the disks available for reconfiguration as cache storage.

code.title: To reset cache disks in error status

example.para: Retrieves an archived virtual tape from the virtual tape shelf (VTS) to a gateway-VTL. Virtual tapes archived in the VTS are not associated with any gateway.

code.title: To retrieve an archived tape from the VTS

example.para: Retrieves the recovery point for the specified virtual tape.

code.title: To retrieve the recovery point of a virtual tape

example.para: Sets the password for your VM local console.

code.title: To set a password for your VM

example.para: This operation shuts down the gateway service component running in the storage gateway's virtual machine (VM) and not the VM.

code.title: To shut down a gateway service

example.para: Starts a gateway service that was previously shut down.

code.title: To start a gateway service

example.para: Updates the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway. Both the upload and download bandwidth rate limit can be set, or either one of the two. If a new limit is not set, the existing rate limit remains.

code.title: To update the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway

example.para: Updates the Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) credentials for a specified iSCSI target.

code.title: To update CHAP credentials for an iSCSI target

example.para: Updates a gateway's metadata, which includes the gateway's name and time zone.

code.title: To update a gateway's metadata

example.para: Updates the gateway virtual machine (VM) software. The request immediately triggers the software update.

code.title: To update a gateway's VM software

example.para: Updates a gateway's weekly maintenance start time information, including day and time of the week. The maintenance time is in your gateway's time zone.

code.title: To update a gateway's maintenance start time

example.para: Updates a snapshot schedule configured for a gateway volume.

code.title: To update a volume snapshot schedule

example.para: Updates the type of medium changer in a gateway-VTL after a gateway-VTL is activated.

code.title: To update a VTL device type
